result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry L. Warren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $222.80 to the victim's mother.

Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
Pay DNA Surcharge 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  with N.A.C. her family, residence or place of employment.
No contact with any known or reported gang member.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do no possess/consume controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Complete a sex offender assessment and comply with the recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass Assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments and/or treatment.
Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.
Provide DNA Sample.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Revoked Extended Supervision- Sentenced to Prison
of Sentencing Hearing on 07-09-15

Defendant Terry L. Warren in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Terry L. Warren in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:43 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Kryshak has no corrections to the PSI and see's not reason why his client should not be senteced today.
Atty Cousins has a victim witness impact statement and provides to the Court; Court takes a minute to read the statement.
Atty Cousins questions the parties in the galley if they would like to make a statement and there is no one. 
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing and states his recommendations:
30 months initial confinement with 42 months extended supervision with 278 days of jail credit and would recommend the extended conditions as listed on 
Page 23 of the PSI and the restitution as outlined in the PSI.
9:55 a.m.  Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant makes a statement prior to his sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 (amended) -
Determinate sentence of 7 years
2 years initial prison confinement
5 years extended supervision
Jail credit of 278 days 
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  with N.A.C. her family, residence or place of employment
No contact with any known or reported gang member
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do no possess/consume controlled substance without a valid prescription.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Complete a sex offender assessment and comply with the recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compass Assessment and the Department of Corrections
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments and/or treatment.
Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days prior to discharge.
Pay DNA Surcharge 
Provide DNA Sample 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Pay restitution in the amount of $222.80 to the victim's mother.

Defendant is informed of his appeal rights
Defendant is remanded to the Portage County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the Wisconsin Prison System
Sentencing hearing at 07-09-2015 09:30 am

ADDRESS INFO for Terry L. Warren
Current: 2331 Jelinski Cir, Plover, WI 54467-2910 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2015)
Prior: 649 Washington Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Sentencing hearing at 06-02-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Terry L. Warren in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Terry L. Warren in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:42 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Count 1 is being amended. State has filed an amended information.

Defendant will plead to the amended Count 1 and request a PSI. State will argue at sentencing.

Atty Kryshak concurs.

Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the amended information.
Court informs Defendant of the charge and penalties.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to the amended Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Defendant understands that this will result in a felony conviction.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Amended Count 1: 940.225(3)

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry L. Warren in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Terry L. Warren in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Atty Kryshak makes arguments re: motion for bond.
Atty Cousins makes arguments in opposition to the bond modification request. 
Atty Kryshak makes additional arguments. 

BY THE COURT: Motion to Modify is denied. 

Atty Cousins makes statement re: motion for testing.  Stipulation to that motion. 
Atty Kryshak does not object. 
BY THE COURT:  Motion for testing is granted. To submit to the test within 3 days.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
